title: Trump Administration Rescinds Federal Funding Freeze After Court Ruling and Backlash
description: By Evan Ward   President Donald Trump’s administration on Wednesday rescinded a Project 2025-inspired order that had abruptly frozen most federal grants and loans, a sweeping directive that threw social service programs like Head Start, student loans, and Medicaid into disarray. The initial order, issued earlier in the week, sparked widespread confusion and disruption, prompting […]

author: Jennifer McLelland
title: Analysis: The Power of Storytelling and Why it Matters Now More Than Ever
description: Health care and disability rights advocates are gearing up to make sure politicians understand that there is no way to cut Medicaid without hurting people who need care. Sharing real people’s stories will be key to that effort.

author: Evan Ward
title: California vs. Hate Aims to Improve Reporting in Rural Areas
description: Edward Henderson | California Black Media In May of 2023, California launched an anti-hate hotline and resource network, California vs Hate, to address a sharp rise in reported hate crimes targeting racial and ethnic minority populations. While data has shown reported incidents nearly doubled since 2019, rural areas of California continue to be underreported.

author: BoldLatina News
title: Trump's Sweeping Executive Orders: What They Mean For Latinos
description: On his first day back as president, Donald Trump signed 46 executive orders shaping immigration, citizenship, and cultural identity. BoldLatina examines the policies threatening the Latino community.

author: Lauren DeLaunay Miller
title: How Restorative Justice Helped One Family Move Forward
description: For one dedicated couple, embracing restorative justice was the first step toward healing their family. The Contra Costa County Family Justice Center's CHAT Project has been a beacon of hope, one that has given them the tools they each needed to co-parent effectively while mending their own relationship.

author: BoldLatina News
title: 2025 Immigration Enforcement Under Trump: Policies, Rights, and Community Support for Undocumented Immigrants
description: The latest updates on Trump’s immigration policies in 2025, including the Laken Riley Act, increased ICE raids, and changes to sanctuary city protections. Learn about legal rights for undocumented immigrants and resources for advocacy and support.

author: Claudia Boyd-Barrett
title: What Has And Hasn’t Happened in the Year Since San Diego’s Devastating Floods
description: About 5,000 San Diego-area residents were impacted by the historic downpour last January that led to dramatic flooding. Extreme flooding events are becoming more common as the climate warms.

author: Evan Ward
title: Congresswoman Simon Ceremonially Sworn in by Vice President Kamala Harris
description: By Evan Ward On January 7, 2025, Congresswoman Lateefah Simon (D-CA-12) stood in the vice president’s ceremonial office, flanked by family and friends, as Kamala Harris swore her in. It wasn’t just a photo-op.

author: Evan Ward
title: Wiley Is New Alameda County Superior Court Judge
description: Former San Francisco Inspector General, Terry Wiley, was sworn in Wednesday as an Alameda County Superior Court Judge. Judge Wiley also worked as an Alameda County Prosecutor.

author: Evan Ward
title: 14 New California Laws You Should Know About
description: Antonio Ray Harvey | California Black Media Several new laws took effect on Jan. 1 in California that may impact your job, business, finances, privacy, family, and day-to-day life.

author: Evan Ward
title: Fierce Wildfires Ravage Los Angeles, Displacing Thousands: How to Help
description: By Stacy M. Brown NNPA Newswire Senior National Correspondent @StacyBrownMedia Fierce wildfires are devastating the greater Los Angeles area, claiming at least five lives and forcing 100,000 residents to evacuate.

author: Evan Ward
title: Vol 80 No. 47

author: Jodi Ravel
title: Why Emergency Medical Services Are Vital to Our Health Care System
description: When dialing 911 for a medical emergency, the expectation is clear: Licensed health care providers, typically paramedics and emergency medical technicians, will arrive within minutes at your location, any time of the day or night. Despite these responsibilities, emergency medical services are often overlooked in health care reform discussions.

author: BoldLatina News
title: BoldLatina’s Top 10 of 2024: Must-Read Articles By and For Latinas
description: From stories that celebrate our resilience to insights that inspire our growth, BoldLatina’s Top 10 articles of 2024 are a tribute to everything by and for Latinas. Dive into the pieces that made an impact this year crafted with our voices, our experiences, and our future in mind.

author: Marina Carlevaro
title: Meet Marce la Recicladora: The Colombian Activist Using Social Media to Transform Recycling
description: Meet Marce la Recicladora, created by Colombian activist Sara Samaniego to highlight Bogotá’s informal recyclers. Through social media, Marce educates on proper recycling, challenges stigmas, and inspires change, showing how small actions can turn trash into treasures and empower communities.

author: Fatima Camacho
title: Latina Jewelry Designers Revolutionizing Style and Culture
description: Latina and Afro-Latina jewelry designers blend culture, identity, and artistry into stunning pieces that honor heritage and redefine luxury. From handmade designs to modern elegance, these brands tell stories that inspire and empower.

author: Carolina Morales
title: Analysis: How Restorative Justice Can Bring Safety and Support to Survivors During the Holidays
description: For many people, the holidays are an opportunity to come together with family and foster connections and belonging. However, for survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault, it can be a time of increased abuse, reliving traumatic past events, and not receiving the appropriate supports for safety.

author: Fatima Camacho
title: Latinas in Law Enforcement Are Building Trust in the Communities
description: Latina police officers are transforming law enforcement, breaking barriers with just 13.8% female representation. These resilient women bring cultural insight, empathy, and leadership, challenging stereotypes while building stronger, more trusting community connections.

author: Sofía Félix Poggi
title: LA LIBRERÍA: The Only Children’s Spanish Bookshop in Los Angeles
description: Discover LA LIBRERÍA, LA's only Spanish children's bookstore, offering a diverse selection of Latin American and Spanish titles, cultural events, and educational programs in a vibrant new space.

author: Marina Carlevaro
title: 7 Must-Watch Documentaries That Celebrate Democracy, Diversity, and Resilience in the US
description: Explore 7 documentaries celebrating US diversity and resilience. From LGBTQIA+ representation to Latino immigration, these docs showcase civil rights, cultural icons, and changing demographics.

author: Marina Carlevaro
title: A Decade of Injustice Remembering Mexico's Missing Students of Ayotzinapa and Their Mothers' Fight for Truth
description: Ten years after 43 students from Ayotzinapa disappeared, their mothers continue a relentless search for justice. Stories of mothers like Cristina and Hilda reveal enduring hope and heartbreak.

author: Fatima Camacho
title: Election 2024: What’s at Stake for U.S. Latinas
description: Latina voters play a crucial role in the 2024 U.S. election, key issues at stake: abortion rights, affordable housing, and immigration policies.

author: Marina Carlevaro
title: Día de Muertos: Where to Celebrate the Day of the Dead in the US
description:
Día de los Muertos is a beautiful reminder that those we’ve loved are never truly gone. Do you know where to celebrate with our community in the United States?

Through colorful altars, music, and memories, we welcome their spirits back for a joyful reunion.

author: DJ Marilynn
title: K-Maxx Joins His Ancestors
description: The following statement was posted on K-Maxx’s Instagram account: “It is with profound sadness and a heavy heart that we share with you the news that Kenyan “K-Maxx” Hopkins suddenly and unexpectedly passed away on December 29, 2020. He was a brother, an amazing musician, and a cherished friend to all.

author: DJ Marilynn
title: Emmit A. Powell, 1933-2018
description: It is with a heavy heart that we announce the passing of one of our own, Brother Emmit Powell.

author: DJ Marilynn
title: Bobbie “Spider” Webb Services
description: It is with a heavy heart that we announce the passing of Bobbie Webb. Bobbie “Spider” Webb joined his ancestors on Friday, September 21, 2018.
